title: South Korea Confirms 2 More Deaths in MERS Outbreak : r/worldnews - Reddit
body: 34M subscribers in the worldnews community. A place for major news from around the world, excluding US-internal news.
readable_content:
helpmyduck (2015-06-05): South Korea Confirms 2 More Deaths in MERS Outbreak nytimes.com

bringing the total number of MERS cases in South Korea to 41
Not much of an "outbreak". Though, it is a typical Korean pandemic.

- only_response_needed (2015-06-05): South Korea Confirms 2 More Deaths in MERS Outbreak: even though the number of cases is relatively low, the emergence of MERS is still cause for concern, especially given its potential to spread further.
